New Records: The Cavaliers are halfway through a brutal four-game West Coast road trip
Key Match Events: Darius Garland picked off an errant Wiggins pass and scored on a layup to extend Cleveland's lead to 44-36 with just under two minutes in the first half.
Garland's sequence set the tone for decisive 20-5 run that put the game out of reach late in the third quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland, which was coming off a 149-135 win against Denver on Friday, now looks ahead to road games against the Lakers on Tuesday and Dallas on Friday.
After going 12-3 to start the season, Golden State is in a freefall after losing four of its last five games and 13 of 17.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland extended their winning streak to seven games with a 113-95 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Monday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors shot 33.3% from the field and were 9 for 38 (23.7%) from beyond the arc.
Cleveland shot 45.8% from the field and 18 for 47 (38.3%) from the 3-point line.
Others: Up Next: Cleveland plays at Los Angeles Tuesday night, and Golden State hosts Philadelphia on Thursday night.
